trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the font properties of text.
This class cannot be inherited.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class to encapsulate the font properties of text.
You can specify the font name and font size.
You can also specify whether the style of the font is bold, italic, overlined, strikethrough, or underlined.

This class is commonly used in a property for a class that requires font information, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Font%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class.
This class does not have a public constructor.
A new instance of the class cannot be created directly.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is bold.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Bold%2A> property to specify or determine whether the font is bold.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
`true` if the font is bold; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Resets all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> properties to the unset state and clears the view state.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> properties are unset when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> object is created.
When a property is first set, the value is added to view state.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.ClearDefaults%2A> method is used to set all the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> properties to the unset state and remove any entries in view state.
The following properties are reset:

Duplicates the font properties of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> into the instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> class that this method is called from.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.CopyFrom%2A> method to duplicate the font properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> into the instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class that this method is called from.
All properties in the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class will be replaced by the associated property in the `f` parameter.

When a style is registered using <xref:System.Web.UI.IStyleSheet.RegisterStyle%2A>, and then copied using <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.CopyFrom%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style%29?displayProperty=fullName>, only the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.CssClass%2A> property is copied to the destination, not all the individual properties.

Therefore, if you are using <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.CopyFrom%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo%29?displayProperty=fullName> to copy font information from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.Font%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> that is registered, you will not get the individual settings of the font from the style.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> that contains the font properties to duplicate.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is italic.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Italic%2A> property to specify or determine whether the font is italic.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
`true` if the font is italic; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.

Combines the font properties of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> with the instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> class that this method is called from.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the font properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> with the instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class that this method is called from.

This method joins the properties of the two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> objects by setting each property that is not set in the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class with the value in the corresponding property of the `f` parameter.
Only properties that have not been set will be replaced.
If a property in the `f` parameter is not set, it will not replace the corresponding property in the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> that contains the font properties to combine.
Gets or sets the primary font name.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property to specify or determine the primary font name.
The primary font name determines the font that is used to display text in the control associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo>.

When you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property is automatically updated with the first item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property.

If you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property is automatically updated with a single element array containing the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property.
The primary font name.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
The specified font name is null.
Gets or sets an ordered array of font names.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property to specify or determine an ordered array of font names for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property is commonly used to store a list of available font names.

When you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property is automatically updated with the first item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property.

If you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property is automatically updated with a single element array containing the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property.

To specify the font name for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> array, set the first element in the array to the font name you want to use.

Since the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property is automatically updated when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property is set, you need to manipulate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> array to rearrange the order of the items in the array instead of setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Name%2A> property directly.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
An ordered array of font names.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is overlined.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Overline%2A> property to specify or determine whether the font contains a line above the text.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The font underline behavior for links generated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlAnchor> controls is affected by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Overline%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> for the control.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Overline%2A> property is set, regardless of value its value, you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Underline%2A> property explicitly if you want the link to be underlined.
`true` if the font is overlined; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names"></xref> property should be persisted.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.ShouldSerializeNames%2A> method to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property has changed from its default value.

This method is commonly used if you are either creating a designer for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class or creating your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names%2A> property must have at least one entry to be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Names"></xref> property has changed from its default value; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the font size.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Size%2A> property to specify the size of the font.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontUnit"></xref> that represents the font size.
The specified font size is negative.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is strikethrough.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Strikeout%2A> property to specify or determine whether the font contains a line through the text.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The font underline behavior for links generated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlAnchor> controls is affected by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Strikeout%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> for the control.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Strikeout%2A> property is set, regardless of its value, you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Underline%2A> property explicitly if you want the link to be underlined.
`true` if the font is struck through; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Returns a string that contains the font name and size for an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.ToString%2A> method to create a string that contains the font name and size, separated by a comma, for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Size%2A> property is not set, only the font name is returned.
A string that contains the font name and size for an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the font is underlined.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Underline%2A> property to specify or determine whether the font contains a line under the text.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The font underline behavior for links generated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlAnchor> controls is affected by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Strikeout%2A> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Overline%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> for the control.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Strikeout%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Overline%2A> properties are set, regardless of their value, you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo.Underline%2A> property explicitly if you want the link to be underlined.
`true` if the font is underlined; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
